summary: Netflix will post its second quarter 2025 financial results and business outlook on July 17, 2025 . A live video interview with co-CEOsTed SarandosandGreg Peters, Chief Financial OfficerSpence Neumann and VP, Finance/IR & Corporate Development Spencer Wang will begin at 1:45 p.m. Pacific Time . Management will answer questions submitted by sell side analysts .  Netflix members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere . Members can change their plans at any time. across a wide variety of genres and languages .

Polkadot is aiming to power the next generation of Web3 applications . The Web3 Foundation's official crypto coin is becoming a distributed supercomputer . Web3 could disrupt giants like Meta Platforms, Alphabet, and Netflix in the future .  Polkadot's Web3 app-building ecosystem provides a handy platform to get all the Web3 ideas done in the real world . Web3 apps could take over your online community connections, your day-to-day financial management processes, and your favorite channels for text, video, and audio infotainment . When tweaked just right, smart contracts can run any kind of program and perform all sorts of services .  Polkadot's central blockchain will soon be replaced by a more flexible and standards-based system known as JAM . This is actually a virtual machine in the blockchain universe . It can compile and run any code for bog-standard central processors, because it's a software-driven and full-featured RISC-V processor .  Polkadot is coming up, probably in the second half of 2025 . Imagine what this on-demand supercomputer can do for the Web3 vision . JAM won't cause an immediate frenzy, because it takes time for people to use new tools . I expect Web3 alternatives to disrupt the online experience as you know it today .  Polkadot can be a big long-term winner even if it never matches the Magnificent 7 group's trillion-dollar market caps . The Web3 project is only worth $6.6 billion today, which is a far cry from the trillion dollar titans you see ruling today's Web2 structure . The coin price could multiply by 10 or 100 and still look small next to Meta and Alphabet . Other cryptocurrencies can also support Web3-worthy apps .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is998% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to174% for the S&P 500 . Polkadot wasn’t one of the 10 stocks that made the cut .  Polkadot was recently valued at $5,000 by The Motley Fool . The company is now owned by several directors of the company .

Netflix is the leader in streaming, and it has been able to meet new demand in innovative ways over the years . Today, it's a household name with formidable assets and it's the leading paid streaming service . The stock trades at a premium valuation .  The streaming company went public in 2002, five years before it became a streaming company . Early investors either saw a great spark of innovation or were just lucky . Today, the company services more than 300 million global viewers .  Management is guiding for revenue to increase 15.4% in the second quarter and for an operating margin of 33.3% . Netflix shifted directions several times in the past, from its origins as a DVD company to streaming, and from a premium network to offering the ad-supported tier .  Netflix stock has delivered for shareholders, and it has a premium price tag to show for it . Netflix stock trades at a price-to-earnings ratio of 57 and a price to sales ratio of 13 . Management had plans to reach a market cap of $1 trillion by 2030 .  Netflix is a mature company, and it would have to keep up the growth it's reporting today to double revenue over the next five years . It would require a compound annual growth rate of 15% to double its market cap even with those growth rates . Unless you invest a lot of money and have a long time horizon, I don't think Netflix stock will set you up for life . Warren Buffett's incredible stock-picking ability has propelled Berkshire Hathaway to market-beating returns for six decades . He plans to step down at the end of 2025, capping off a stellar run of success that dates back to 1965 . You don't need to be as skilled as Buffett to succeed in the stock market, because simple index funds can deliver spectacular returns .  The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF tracks the index by investing in exactly the same companies . It could turn $500 per month into $1 million over the long term . The index is made up of 500 different companies, and they have to meet strict criteria to be included .  The information technology sector has a massive weighting of 30.4% in the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF . It's home to the world's three largest companies --Microsoft,Nvidia, andApple -- which have a combined market cap of $10 trillion . Artificial intelligence is a dominant theme in the stock market right now .  The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF is one of the cheapest ways to invest in the benchmark index . It features an expense ratio of just 0.03%, meaning an investment of $10,000 will incur an annual fee of just $3 . The index offers investors exposure to the industrial, energy, and real estate sectors .  The S&P 500 has delivered a compound annual return of 10.3% since it was established in 1957 . Based on that return, investors who deploy $500 per month could join the millionaires' club within 30 years . Back of simmering global trade tensions that were triggered by President Trump's tariffs .  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang predicts AI data center spending will reach $1 trillionper year by 2028 . The S&P 500 is still likely to be significantly higher by then, so investors who start their investing journey today will almost certainly be better off .
